appeal.description: This schema represents the appeal process for a planning application currently based on the implentation in BOPS and DPR

decision.description: The decision made by the planning inspectorate

decisionDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the planning inspectorate published their decision about the appeal. This decision is final.

files.description: Any files uploaded as part of the appeal process

lodgedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date an appeal was lodged with the planning inspectorate. At this stage the appeal still needs to be checked that it valid.

startedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the planning inspectorate began considering the appeal.

validatedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the appeal was confirmed to be valid. This appeal can now be examined in detail by the planning inspectorate.

publishedAt.description: The date the application was made available to the public Should be the same as the consultation start date or the date the application was validated if no consultation stage

reference.description: Unique reference for the application from start to finish

stage.description: The current stage the application is at Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

status.description: What is the status of the application Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

withdrawnAt.description: Applications can be withdrawn by the applicant at any time before a decision is made. This is the date the appeal was withdrawn.

withdrawnReason.description: The reason the application was withdrawn

endDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the statutory consultation will end for the application.

startDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the consultation will start for the application.

publicCommentsAcceptedUntilDecision.description: When an application is validated it immediately goes into the consultation stage (if the application type allows it) However some LPA's allow comments until a decision regardles of whether there is a consultation stage This field allows LPA's to set this behaviour per application in their back office and not obstruct the planning process

submittedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date which the application was submitted, either through PlanX or for example the date written on the envelope if it was posted.

isValid.description: This determines whether or not an application was found to be valid

receivedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application is received by the back office system. It may not be the date it was submitted, if there have been delays in the submission process.

validatedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application was validated. Usually this will be the same as the received date, but sometimes applications are submitted incorrectly, and need correcting to be valid. Having a validatedAt date doesn't neccearily mean the application is valid, it just means it has been checked. This could also be considered the return date, as it is the date the application is returned to the applicant if it is invalid.

startedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the planning inspectorate began considering the appeal.

validatedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the appeal was confirmed to be valid. This appeal can now be examined in detail by the planning inspectorate.

publishedAt.description: The date the application was made available to the public Should be the same as the consultation start date or the date the application was validated if no consultation stage

reference.description: Unique reference for the application from start to finish

stage.description: The current stage the application is at Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

status.description: What is the status of the application Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

withdrawnAt.description: Applications can be withdrawn by the applicant at any time before a decision is made. This is the date the appeal was withdrawn.

withdrawnReason.description: The reason the application was withdrawn

endDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the statutory consultation will end for the application.

startDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the consultation will start for the application.

publicCommentsAcceptedUntilDecision.description: When an application is validated it immediately goes into the consultation stage (if the application type allows it) However some LPA's allow comments until a decision regardles of whether there is a consultation stage This field allows LPA's to set this behaviour per application in their back office and not obstruct the planning process

submittedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date which the application was submitted, either through PlanX or for example the date written on the envelope if it was posted.

isValid.description: This determines whether or not an application was found to be valid

receivedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application is received by the back office system. It may not be the date it was submitted, if there have been delays in the submission process.

validatedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application was validated. committeeDecision.description: If an application went to committee what was their decision

committeeDecisionDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD The date the committee made their decision

decisionNotice.description: The url to the decision notice A decision notice is issued when an application is determined or withdrawn

expiryDate.description: The decision has to be made before this date if not an appeal can be made on the grounds of non-determination

planningOfficerDecision.description: This is the decision made by planning officer(s) in a LPA

planningOfficerDecisionDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date the decision was made by planning officer(s) in a LPA

planningOfficerRecommendation.description: This is the recommendation made by planning officer(s) to the committee This is an alternative to a decision - either planningOfficerDecision or planningOfficerRecommendation can be set not both

PostSubmissionFile.description: File uploaded and labeled by the user to support the application

association.description: Which part of the application this file is associated with.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the file itself was created

mimeType.description: MIME type of the file, e.g. 'image/png', 'application/pdf'

publishedAt.description: Date and time when the file was published

size.description: file size in bytes, allows for more units in the future if needed

submittedAt.description: Date and time the file was received by the system or uploaded. This will usually match the submittedAt date of the application, but if the file is amended or uploaded later it will differ.

validatedAt.description: Date and time when the file was validated

name.description: Filename or title of the file

redactedUrl.description: URL where the redacted file can be accessed

referencesInDocument.description: Optional list of document references in the file. Where documents contain multiple drawings, include the references here eg ["25A-V2", "25B-V2"]).

thumbnailUrl.description: URL to a thumbnail image of the file, if applicable

type.description: What type of file this is. This is an array to allow for multiple types, as a file can be associated with more than one type.

url.description: URL where the file can be accessed

version.description: Version of the file, used to track changes or updates

PostSubmissionFileAssociation.description: Type of file association for a post-submission file.

This is the date the schema for this application was generated by the API/file system.

startedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the planning inspectorate began considering the appeal.

validatedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the appeal was confirmed to be valid. This appeal can now be examined in detail by the planning inspectorate.

publishedAt.description: The date the application was made available to the public Should be the same as the consultation start date or the date the application was validated if no consultation stage

reference.description: Unique reference for the application from start to finish

stage.description: The current stage the application is at Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

status.description: What is the status of the application Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

withdrawnAt.description: Applications can be withdrawn by the applicant at any time before a decision is made. This is the date the appeal was withdrawn.

withdrawnReason.description: The reason the application was withdrawn

endDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the statutory consultation will end for the application.

startDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the consultation will start for the application.

publicCommentsAcceptedUntilDecision.description: When an application is validated it immediately goes into the consultation stage (if the application type allows it) However some LPA's allow comments until a decision regardles of whether there is a consultation stage This field allows LPA's to set this behaviour per application in their back office and not obstruct the planning process

submittedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date which the application was submitted, either through PlanX or for example the date written on the envelope if it was posted.

isValid.description: This determines whether or not an application was found to be valid

receivedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application is received by the back office system. It may not be the date it was submitted, if there have been delays in the submission process.

validatedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application was validated. Usually this will be the same as the received date, but sometimes applications are submitted incorrectly, and need correcting to be valid. Having a validatedAt date doesn't neccearily mean the application is valid, it just means it has been checked. This could also be considered the return date, as it is the date the application is returned to the applicant if it is invalid.

receivedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application is received by the back office system. It may not be the date it was submitted, if there have been delays in the submission process.

validatedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application was validated. Usually this will be the same as the received date, but sometimes applications are submitted incorrectly, and need correcting to be valid. Having a validatedAt date doesn't neccearily mean the application is valid, it just means it has been checked. This could also be considered the return date, as it is the date the application is returned to the applicant if it is invalid.

appeal.description: This schema represents the appeal process for a planning application currently based on the implentation in BOPS and DPR

decision.description: The decision made by the planning inspectorate

decisionDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the planning inspectorate published their decision about the appeal. This decision is final.

files.description: Any files uploaded as part of the appeal process

lodgedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date an appeal was lodged with the planning inspectorate. At this stage the appeal still needs to be checked that it valid.

startedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the planning inspectorate began considering the appeal.

validatedDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD Follows convention of if date in the name it is YYYY-MM-DD The date the appeal was confirmed to be valid. This appeal can now be examined in detail by the planning inspectorate.

publishedAt.description: The date the application was made available to the public Should be the same as the consultation start date or the date the application was validated if no consultation stage

reference.description: Unique reference for the application from start to finish

stage.description: The current stage the application is at Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

status.description: What is the status of the application Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

withdrawnAt.description: Applications can be withdrawn by the applicant at any time before a decision is made. This is the date the appeal was withdrawn.

withdrawnReason.description: The reason the application was withdrawn

endDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the statutory consultation will end for the application.

startDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the consultation will start for the application.

publicCommentsAcceptedUntilDecision.description: When an application is validated it immediately goes into the consultation stage (if the application type allows it) However some LPA's allow comments until a decision regardles of whether there is a consultation stage This field allows LPA's to set this behaviour per application in their back office and not obstruct the planning process

stage.description: The current stage the application is at Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

status.description: What is the status of the application Additional contextual information can be found in the rest of the application

withdrawnAt.description: Applications can be withdrawn by the applicant at any time before a decision is made. This is the date the appeal was withdrawn.

withdrawnReason.description: The reason the application was withdrawn

endDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the statutory consultation will end for the application.

startDate.description: YYYY-MM-DD This is the date that the consultation will start for the application.

publicCommentsAcceptedUntilDecision.description: When an application is validated it immediately goes into the consultation stage (if the application type allows it) However some LPA's allow comments until a decision regardles of whether there is a consultation stage This field allows LPA's to set this behaviour per application in their back office and not obstruct the planning process

submittedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date which the application was submitted, either through PlanX or for example the date written on the envelope if it was posted.

isValid.description: This determines whether or not an application was found to be valid

receivedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application is received by the back office system. It may not be the date it was submitted, if there have been delays in the submission process.

validatedAt.description: ISO 8601 DateTime This is the date that the application was validated. Usually this will be the same as the received date, but sometimes applications are submitted incorrectly, and need correcting to be valid. Having a validatedAt date doesn't neccearily mean the application is valid, it just means it has been checked. This could also be considered the return date, as it is the date the application is returned to the applicant if it is invalid.
